disp-quote.p: “ I once had a problem of fatigue and dizziness and I decided to come back to ask further about the pill they had given me and how it works because once I took it the next day in the morning when the sun rose I had fatigue and head ache. It happened for a few days of which now it has passed. […] I told myself that I will not stop [PrEP] but rather rush to the clinic to ask those who gave me the medication why it happens that way. They gave me those pamphlets but at times English is difficult to understand, and I asked them to give me Shona ones […] so that I can sit and read comfortably. I was given and I read them and understood. ”–Female, 28, in SDC (RUR01) (AAA)
